occurrences.text: fulfilled their ministry. They were given a responsibility at the end of the text of Scripture to provide relief for the brethren that dwelt in Judea. And it tells us in verse 30, which also they did and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul. They had been given a task, and they fulfilled their ministry in teaching in Antioch, and then they took that offering that had been brought up for the believers in Judea, and they took it. They fulfilled their ministry in Acts 12, in verse 25. Notice in Acts 13, in verse number 25. Just a page or two over, the Bible says, and as John fulfilled his course, he said, whom think ye that I am? I am not he, but behold, there cometh one after me whose shoes of his feet I am not worthy to lose. Who is he speaking of? John the Baptist. Right? John the Baptist. You read in the Gospel of John, and you read about John the Baptist. It was in the third chapter, that great declaration when he says, I must decrease, but he must increase. But John had been given an assignment. He was the forerunner of the Lord Jesus Christ. He was the one that said, behold, the Lamb of God which taketh away the sin of the world. And John the Baptist, it says here in Acts 13, that as John fulfilled his course, he ran his race. He finished.
